The contents of input are as follows:
"input":"Initially, the reaction between 2,3-diphenyl 2H-azirine 1a and acetone 2 was selected as the model reaction to optimize the reaction conditions (Table 1). Delightfully, both pyrrole 3a and 3-oxazoline 4a could be observed. When using Zn(OTf)2 as the catalyst, products 3a and 4a could be obtained in 17 and 50% yields, respectively (entry 1). Further investigation on the metal salts or TfOH could not improve the yield of 3a (entries 2−8), while the yield of 4a could be increased to 63% in the presence of TfOH (entry 8). Subsequently, the solvents and catalyst loading were screened (Tables S7/S8 in the Supporting Information). Unfortunately, no better result was obtained. And 3-oxazoline was ultimately obtained in a 74% yield by increasing the loading of TfOH to 20 mol % and prolonging the reaction time to 48 h (entry 9). To further improve the yield of 3a, a series of bases were added. It was found that the inorganic bases showed better results than the organic ones (entries 10−16), offering 3a in a 67% yield when NaOH was added (entry 10). Finally, pyrrole 3a was isolated in an 81% yield by increasing the loading of NaOH to 1.2 equiv and prolonging the reaction time to 48 h."

"input":"We started by using 20 mol % of Pd(OAc)2 as catalyst, 2 equiv of Cu(OAc)2 as oxidant, and 5 equiv of pivalic acid (PivOH) as additive in HFIP at 100 °C for 2 h; the target C7 trifluoromethylated product 3a was obtained in 88% yield (Table S1, entry 1). Next, control experiments showed that without catalyst Pd(OAc)2, oxidant Cu(OAc)2 or PivOH additive resulted in lower reactivity, indicating that Pd(OAc)2, Cu(OAc)2, and PivOH may play an essential roles for the product formation (Table S1, entries 2−4)"

"input":"Initially, we set up our reaction using 2-phenyl-1Hphenanthro[9,10-d]imidazole 1a and methyl acrylate 2a as substrates using [Ru(p-cymene)Cl2]2 as a catalyst, Cu(OAc)2· H2O as an oxidant, AgSbF6 as an additive, and DCE as a solvent under a nitrogen atmosphere at 120 °C. We obtained the desired product 3aa in 40% yield (Table 1, entry 1). For optimization, we screened other oxidants such as CuO, Ag2O, and Ag2CO3 (Table 1, entries 2−4), but the yield was reduced significantly. Upon further screening, we found that AgOAc increased the yield to 50% (Table 1, entry 5). The replacement of AgSbF6 with other additives such as NaSbF6 and AgNTf2 resulted in low yield (Table 1, entries 6−7). Even the addition of bases like K2CO3 and NaOAc caused low reactivity (Table 1, entries 8 and 9)."

"input":"By employing Et3B as the key activator, racemic allylic alcohols can be directly ionized to form Pd or Ir-π-allyl species in the presence of achiral Pd or chiral Ir complexes, respectively. The less or more substituted allylic termini of the metal-π-allyl species are amenable to nucleophilic attack by the chiral Cuazomethine ylide, the formation of which is simultaneously facilitated by Et3B, affording α-quaternary αamino acids with high regioselectivity and excellent stereoselectivity. "

"input":"We began our investigations by exploring the asymmetric alkyl transfer reaction of α-fluoro alkenyl amide 1a with tert-butyl bromide in the presence of various nickel catalysts, chiral ligands, and reductants. The experiments revealed that the formation of the enantioenriched secondary α-fluoro amide 2a was feasible with the combination of catalytic NiBr2·(PPh3)2, chiral tridentate Pybox ligands, and (MeO)3SiH in the presence of K3PO4 as a base, with isopropyl alcohol and ZnI2 as the additives (Table 1)."

"input":"Uemura et al. applied a ruthenium catalyst system based on ligand (S)-L40 to the asymmetric hydrosilylation of prochiral ketones, demonstrating the effectiveness of additional precious metals in hydrosilylation reactions.49 The additive Cu(OTf)2 proved superior to AgOTf in improving reactivity and enantioselectivity (Scheme 16). The results were excellent in terms of both yield and ee values when applied to aryl ketones (Scheme 17). "

"input":"The scope of this reaction with respect to arylboronic acids is also very broad. In addition to various substituted phenyl groups including sterically hindered o-disubstituted groups (3Am), heteroarene and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon moieties (3Ao and 3Ap) could also be coupled. Moreover, alkenylboronic acids also participated well in the decarbonylative cross-coupling to afford the corresponding substituted alkenes in good yields (3Wq and 3Aq), when NaCl was employed as an additive (see Supplementary Table 6)."

"input":"Herein, we reported an efficient 2,2,6,6-tetramethylpiperidinooxy (TEMPO)-promoted para-C−H radical hydroxyfluoroalkylation of arylamines with cheap and easily accessible polyfluorinated alcohols, in which no other additives were needed, producing a series of hydroxyfluoroalkylated arylamines (Scheme 1)."

"input":"The reaction was conducted with 2 equiv of Et2Zn and 1 equiv of bipyridine as a base in THF at 23 °C for 1 h. Unfortunately, the reaction did not proceed under these conditions, and our analysis using 1 H NMR indicated the presence of only the starting imine 1a (Table 1,entry 1). Conversely, we repeated the same conditions but raised the temperature to 60 °C. Fortunately, we obtained allylation products 3ab and 4ab in a 4:1 ratio, with complete consumption of the starting imine 1a (Table 1, entry 2).Similar results were obtained when Et3N was used as the base(Table 1, entry 3)."

"input":"Concomitantly, arsenate was required as an additive to perform the isomerization of D-glucose. Similar kind of studies have also been carried out by Tsumura and Sato to produce D-xylose grown cells of Aerobacter cloacae which was isolated from Japanese soil to perform D-glucose isomerization, but they still entailed arsenate in the reaction system.50,51 The enzyme extracted from the D-xylose-grown cells heterolactic acid bacteria, called glucose isomerase, which has an 8-fold increase in specific activity after the partial purification, was found by Yamanaka in 1963."

"input":"Barker et al. patented the use of arylboric acid as additive together with alkaline solution for the isomerization of glucose to fructose, where they found very high yield, up to 80% of fructose, dependent on reaction parameters such as pH, temperature, and reaction time."
